title: CEC to officers: Ensure strict audit of spending
text:
Jitendra Kumar Shrivastava
Tribune News Service
Muzaffarpur, October 19
Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Nasim Zaidi accompanied by two election commissioners - Achal Kumar Jyoti and OP Rawat — reviewed the poll preparedness for the fourth and fifth phases of the Bihar Assembly poll. The CEC expressed satisfaction over the preparedness at the office of the Divisional Commissioner in Muzaffarpur before ending his two-day visit to the state today. However, expressing dissatisfaction over the expenditure monitoring cell of the election department, Zaidi said much more needed to be done in the department. Zaidi called upon the election officials to ensure social harmony during the Bihar Assembly elections. “As far as law and order is concerned, preventive action is being taken like execution of non-bailable warrants. Inquiry has been initiated in more than 1,700 places in areas of model code of conduct. We need to make sure that the inquiry in unbiased. In Muzaffarpur, we spoke to all officials involved in the third and fourth phase elections. Instructions have been given to them to ensure social harmony during the elections,” Zaidi said. “Got information about the Hawala sting operation, the Tax Department acted and recovered Rs 18 to Rs 19 crore of unaccounted money,” he said. Zaidi said, “In the past 10 days there was no complaint of use of abusive language by any political leader, but the leaders have been advised not to use unparliamentary language against their political opponents. Even the money recovery team has been asked to return money if it is of trade and legal within 24 hours.”
